titleStmt.title: A. L. Giboney to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2139

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Liberty Casey County Ky July 29th 1865
His Excelley Thos. E Bramler
Governor of Kentucky
Dr Sir

there is a vacancy in the office of Justice of the peace in District No 4 (Casey creek) by death of William Clements Esqr I would beg leave to recomend for appointment for that office Jonathan Sweney and George W Earls either of whom would make a good officer and be acceptable to the people. there is also a vacancy in the office of Justice of the peace in District No 2 (Jenkinses) I would recommend Henry by Wil the removal (and reported resignation) of Green L Brown Esqr I would recommend Henry Williams and Isham Carmon either of whoom would be acceptable and make a good officer

Yours with due respect
A. L. Giboney P J C C

Attest
J W Wash clk C C C
Justice Peace
Casey Co
apptd
5 Aug/65
Jonathan Sweney 4 & H. Williams
